Brief Introduction

I attended The Ohio State University before I made the commitment to enlist in the United States Marine Corps. I served four years on active duty in the infantry with 1st Batallion 7th Marines - Baker Company. Near the end of my active service I had been promoted to E-5 (Sergeant) and decided to advance in another direction. Then I found JavaScript and the rest is history
My current goal is to continue to improve my language proficiency and dig deeper into the frameworks available!

My Works in Progress

Here are some of the projects I have been working on! All projects were developed using an Agile work methodology, test driven development and of course, clean code!

  • Virtual Pet
  • High St. Hospital
  • Welp

Virtual Pet

This was a console based application that allowed the player to interact with virtual pets through a shelter system. Players could feed, play and bathe their pets; the game kept track of all the pet and shelter stats. The player goal was to make sure to keep the shelter clean and their pets healthy!

High St Hospital

This was a console based application that mimicked a hospital database. The user could naviagte a custom menu to see: records for the staff and their abilities, the patients and their statuses, as well as being able to exit at their leisure.

Welp

This was a fullstack MVC application that mocked a review site, similar to Yelp, but with memes. Users had the ability to create tags, categories and authors as well as the ability to post reviews and rate them!
